intro: Stevia veronicae var. tenuis, commonly known as slender leaf stevia, is a perennial herb native to South America. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant is known for its high concentration of steviol glycosides, which are natural sweeteners. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for cultivation in temperate climates. Its ornamental value and potential medicinal uses have made it a subject of interest in both horticulture and herbal medicine.
